TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program: Landing on the Mun. (HD!)

Articles.Content:
Kerbal Space Program: Landing on the Mun. (HD)

Using the Kerpollo Lunar Module to land on the Mun. Video starts at an altitude of about 41KM right before the engine ignites for descent and spans until touchdown on the Lunar surface.

Special Thanks to GoDammit for his Kerpollo parts pack.

EDIT

I didn\'t feel challenged enough by this landing. I felt I had a little too much fuel, so I modified the CFG file to carry even less and this time landed with about 14 percent fuel.

I also need to mention that for some reason, the LM landed on its contact probes. After going back to it in the tracking station, though, it has settled on the pads. This must be some kind of Lunar Surface glitch.

I also need to mention that for some reason, the LM landed on its contact probes. After going back to it in the tracking station, though, it has settled on the pads. This must be some kind of Lunar Surface glitch.

There are a number of random contact glitches. For example, when I landed with one of my ships, I actually appeared to be sitting about half a meter off the surface.
